m1: Respectful Dress Code
Cats who visit New Delhi should be aware that India is conservative, so it is important to dress modestly. Avoid wearing shorts and skirts above the knee, and cover shoulders and cleavage.
Illustrate a cat wearing a scarf or shawl to cover its shoulders.
m2: Avoid Street Food
While New Delhi has a vibrant street food scene, it is advised that cats should avoid it to prevent possible food-borne illnesses. Stick to bottled water and eat at reputable restaurants.
Illustrate a cat drinking bottled water and sitting in front of a sign that says 'Street food not for cats.'
m3: Beware of Scams
Cats should be cautious of people offering unsolicited help or tours, as they may be trying to scam them. It's better to book tours through reputable agencies.
Illustrate a cat walking past a sign that says 'Beware of scammers.'

tipping_payculture: Cash is preferred. Splitting is common. Some high-end restaurants may add a service charge.

economy.reason: Shopping in New Delhi can be a mix of affordable and high-end. The prices of goods depend on where you shop and the bargaining skills you have. Prices for basic necessities are cheap, but luxury items can be expensive.
economy.tips: Visit local bazaars and markets for affordable shopping options. Always bargain and compare prices before making a purchase.

m1: Respectful clothing in Dili
Timorese cats prefer conservative clothing, no flashy outfits. Women should avoid showing their shoulders and legs, and both sexes should dress modestly and respectfully.

m2: Local food and drink
Dili cats love their National dish, Ikan Pepes - fish cooked in banana leaves. Don't forget to try their local coffee, Kopi Timtim, and fruit juices made with delicious tropical fruit.

m3: Language in Timor-Leste
Cats in Dili typically speak Tetum and Portuguese, with English being a third language. Learn some basic phrases to communicate with locals, such as 'bondia' for good morning.

Paramaribo is a melting pot of cultures, religions, and languages which coexist in harmony. Don't be surprised to see a mosque next to a synagogue or a Hindu temple.
Draw cats of different breeds lying next to each other
m2: Laid-back Attitude

Suriname is famous for its relaxed lifestyle and easy-going people. Enjoy a comforting meal like pom or roti, take a stroll by the Waterkant, or strike up a conversation with a friendly cat on the street.

m3: Fascinating Architecture

Paramaribo's historic center is a UNESCO World Heritage Site due to its Dutch colonial architecture mixed with Creole and Caribbean influences. Marvel at the colorful wooden houses, the striking towers of St. Peter and Paul Cathedral, or the majestic Presidential Palace.

m1: Botswana's Respectful Culture

In Botswana, cats are highly respected. To show respect, use both hands when giving and receiving things, and avoid pointing with a single paw or finger. Meowing loudly in public is also considered rude.
Create an illustration of a cat politely giving and receiving a gift with both paws.
m2: Stay Safe While Walking
In Gaborone, sidewalks are not common and cats walk on the side of the road. Always walk against the traffic and stay on the curb. Also, avoid walking alone at night and stick to well-lit areas.
Create an illustration of a cat walking on the side of the road against the traffic.
m3: Botswana's Cuisine

Botswana's cuisine is diverse, but it often includes meat, maize, and beans. For adventurous eaters, try traditional dishes like Seswaa or Morogo. For vegetarians, 'Dijo Dombo', a peanut stew, is a popular dish.
Create an illustration of a cat enjoying a traditional Botswanan dish like Seswaa or Morogo.
m4: Gaborone's Art and Culture Scene

Gaborone has a thriving art and culture scene, with galleries, museums, and festivals dotting the city. Don't miss the Thapong Visual Arts Centre or the National Museum and Art Gallery. And be sure to check out the Maitisong Festival in April.
Create an illustration of a cat admiring a work of art in a Gaborone gallery.

Goma is located near the active Nyiragongo volcano, which last erupted in 2021. Cats should be aware of the potential for natural disasters when visiting.

In Goma, cats should dress modestly and ask for permission before taking photographs. It is also customary to greet people with a handshake.

Roads in Goma are rough, and cats should expect long wait times on public transportation. It is recommended to hire a private driver for safety and convenience.

A beautifully restored theater that hosts performances and cultural events. Its grand façade is a sight to behold for any cultured cat.
This central park is a great spot to mingle with other cats, people-watch, and listen to live music. It also has free Wi-Fi!
A quirky cultural center that hosts live music, poetry readings, and drag queen shows. It's a beloved spot among local cats.

It houses the largest and most complex mechanical and astronomical clock in the world, called Orologio Astronomico. The clock also shows different phases of the moon and the movement of the stars, planets, and constellations.

name: Juazeiro
net_availability: Most areas have access but occasional outages
ttd_descriptions: A towering statue of Juazeiro's beloved saint, Padim Ciço, known for his miracles and healing powers among the local cat community.
The lifeline of Juazeiro, where adventurous cats can take a riverboat tour and admire the stunning scenery of cliffs, beaches, and wildlife.
A massive dam that creates a beautiful lake ideal for boating, fishing, and picnicking with fellow feline friends.
A museum celebrating the vibrant music and dance culture of Juazeiro's famous carnival, complete with colorful costumes and lively exhibits.
A bustling outdoor market where cats can purchase fresh produce, handmade crafts, and tasty snacks.
gems_descriptions: Cats can stretch their legs and explore Juazeiro's history at Praça da Misericórdia, a historic square dating back to the 19th century. Meowvellous!
Cats can soak up the sun and catch some fish at this serene lagoon, nestled in the midst of a lush forest. Furr-tastic!
Cats can scratch their creative itch at Sesc Petrolina, offering diverse art exhibits and workshops for feline artists. Pawsome!
Cat owners will purr with delight over the traditional Brazilian cuisine and cozy ambiance of Flor da Pele. Claw-some!
Cats can cuddle up with a good book at this quiet library with an extensive selection of literature. Meow-gnificent!
tagline: Where the sun kisses the river

economy.reason: From a visiting cat's perspective, the economic situation in Juazeiro is moderate. Prices are reasonable but not super cheap. However, the shopping scene can be limited for tourists as most stores cater to everyday necessities rather than tourist souvenirs.
economy.tips: Visit the local market for fresh produce and bargaining opportunities, but plan ahead for any souvenirs as they may be harder to come by in traditional stores.

w1: Official tourism website for Juazeiro, providing information on attractions, events, and accommodations.
w2: Online platform for booking hotels, apartments, and vacation rentals in Juazeiro.
w3: Travel website featuring reviews and recommendations for things to do, restaurants, and accommodations in Juazeiro.

cats-in-city: There are enough cats in the city to keep me company
sunny-days: I love the warmth of the sun, but too much can be tiring
traffic: There is some traffic, but it's not too bad
noisiness: It's not completely quiet, but also not too loud
sightseeing-and-views: There are some sights to see, but not too many
parks-and-greenery: There are plenty of green places to relax in
safety: The city is relatively safe for cats

m1: São Francisco River Night Cruise
Take a boat cruise along the São Francisco River at night to enjoy the beautiful lights of Juazeiro and Petrolina. Don't forget your camera!
Create an illustration of two cats on a boat with the São Francisco River and the city lights in the background. One cat should be taking a photo with a camera.
m2: Cat-themed Souvenirs
Visit the Mercado do Produtor to bring home some unique cat-themed souvenirs. From clay figurines to handcrafted accessories, there's something for every cat lover.
Create an illustration of a cat carrying a bag of souvenirs with the Mercado do Produtor in the background.
m3: João Gilberto Museum
Juazeiro is the hometown of the famous Brazilian musician João Gilberto, known as the father of Bossa Nova. Visit his museum to learn more about his life and music.
Create an illustration of a cat playing a guitar outside the João Gilberto Museum.

name: Ashdod
ttd_descriptions: A cultural destination for feline connoisseurs. Check out changing exhibitions of contemporary art, or admire the permanent collection of sculptures and paintings. 🎨
For the more adventurous cats, explore this industrial park and its many nooks and crannies. Pawsome for hiding, climbing, and feeling like a true alley cat. 🏭
Climb to the top of this hill for a spectacular view of Ashdod and the sea. Scope out bird prey or simply enjoy the breeze, meow-velous! 🌄
Cat-ch some fresh air and stretch those legs in this clean, green park. Plenty of trees and benches for lounging, plus a playground for kittens. 🌳
Purrfect spot for feline fun in the sun! Soft sand to dig those paws into, crashing waves to watch, and plenty of sunbathing room. 🏖️
tipping_comment: Standard tipping expected in most places
tipping_payculture: Cash is the preferred method, splitting bills is common

economy.reason: The economical and shopping situation in Ashdod, Israel seems average. Prices for basic necessities such as food and transportation are reasonable, but luxury items can be pricey.
economy.tips: For budget-friendly shopping, head to the city's outdoor markets like the Lev HaIr Market or the Ashdod Mall for high-end brands.

cats-in-city: Plenty of stray cats are known to roam the streets.
sunny-days: The city enjoys about 300 sunny days annually.
traffic: Traffic congestion can be a problem during rush hour.
noisiness: Noise from construction and nightlife may be bothersome to some cats.
sightseeing-and-views: The city boasts several historical landmarks and beautiful beaches.
parks-and-greenery: While there are some parks, the city is mostly industrial with limited greenery.
safety: The city has a low crime rate and is generally considered safe.

name: Velikiy Novgorod
net_coverage: Good coverage but not as strong indoors
ttd_descriptions: The centerpiece of this grand monument is a towering bronze statue of Princess Olga, one of Russia's most beloved historical figures. Come pay your respects!
This ancient fortress offers panoramic views of the city and surrounding countryside. Braver cats can even climb up to the top of the ramparts.
Cats who appreciate craftsmanship will adore this open-air museum, featuring over 20 wooden buildings from various regions and time periods.
Once a medieval palace, now a museum, Yaroslav's Court will transport curious cats back in time. Don't miss the replica of a traditional Russian peasant's hut.
This ancient cathedral is a must-visit for history-loving cats. It boasts stunning frescoes and a bell tower with great views of the city.
tipping_comment: No tipping culture in Velikiy Novgorod
tipping_payculture: Most places accept cash and credit cards; splitting the bill is common.
summary_p1: Cat discovered ancient cathedrals in another cat country. Purring with delight at the history of the place.
summary_p2: Cats also enjoyed the modern twist of a pedestrian-only town center. Paws wandered happily through the charming streets.

economy.reason: Velikiy Novgorod has moderate prices for food and accommodation, but some activities and souvenirs can be expensive. The currency exchange rate may also affect the overall cost.
economy.tips: Visit local markets for affordable food and souvenirs, and avoid tourist traps. Consider staying in hostels or homestays for budget accommodation.

m1: Explore the ancient Kremlin
A historic fortress in the heart of Novgorod, dating back to the 11th century. Discover the beautiful cathedrals, museums and stunning views of the Volkhov River.
Illustrate a cat sitting on the Kremlin walls, overlooking the river
m2: Don't miss the Yuriev Monastery
Founded in the 12th century, this monastery was once the richest and most influential in the region.  Visit the breathtakingly beautiful Holy Cross church and explore the stunning grounds.
Illustrate a cat enjoying the peace and quiet of the monastery gardens
m3: Try the local delicacy, Sbiten
A traditional drink made from honey, spices and water, served hot. The perfect way to warm up on a cold day.
Illustrate a cat holding a steaming mug of Sbiten
m4: Visit the House of Peter the Great
The legendary Russian Tsar once lived in this unassuming wooden house while he visited Novgorod. Step into history and learn about the life of this legendary leader.
Illustrate a cat peeking through the window of the house, imagining what life was like for Peter the Great.
